title: torch.FloatTensor and similar accept, but ignore device argument
body_html:
Code example

torch.FloatTensor([1], device=torch.device('cuda:0')).device # cpu
torch.IntTensor([1], device=torch.device('cuda:0')).device     # cpu

  • same story when passing string 'cuda:0'.

  • checked that these constructors indeed expect device parameter

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: pytorch 0.4.1

  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip

  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): NA

  • OS: ubuntu 16

  • PyTorch version: 0.4.1

  • Python version: 3.6

  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.0

  • GPU models and configuration: 1070

  • GCC version (if compiling from source): NA

  • CMake version: NA

  • Versions of any other relevant libraries: NA

## Code example

torch.IntTensor([1], device=torch.device('cuda:0')).device     # cpu
